lead_paragraph: A preliminary examination by the Dallas County Medical Examiner’s Office has determined that the woman found dead last week with David Jacobs, a convicted steroids dealer who tied several N.F.L. players to performance-enhancing drugs, was a homicide victim, the police said. The woman, Amanda Jo Earhart-Savell, and Jacobs were found dead on Thursday at Jacobs’s home in Plano, Tex. Last week, a preliminary examination by the medical examiner’s office found that Jacobs had shot himself. The police have said that the deaths are consistent with a murder-suicide.
